title: How to understand the math part in the CLRS Algorithms book - Quora
tags: Introduction to Algorithms (book by Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest and Stein)

response.answer_text: The algorithms course of MIT(from ocw.mit.edu) which pretty much follows the course of the book States mathematics for computer science course(http://ocw.mit.edu/courses/electrical-engineering-and-computer-science/6-042j-mathematics-for-computer-science-fall-2010/) as a pre-requisite...and that really helps in understanding the maths part of clrs better...

The only way to understand the math part is to get yourself a solid understanding of Discrete Mathematics, especially the topics of Probability, Combinatorics, Summations, Proof techniques etc. You may also need some familiarity and comfort with writing proofs.
